name: Print Wordpress Theme Template

name: PHP Time
value:
<?php
//First, be sure to set timezone
date_default_timezone_set('America/Los_Angeles');

//Set variable of today, will print format YYYY-MM-DD
$today = date('Y-m-d');
//Converts the above format into Epoch time (time in seconds, counting from 1-1-1970)
$timestamp = strtotime($today);

//examples:
$lastSun = date('Y-m-d', strtotime("last Sunday"));
$today = date("Y-m-d");
$tomorrow = date("Y-m-d", time()+86400);
?>
description: How to set timezone, set time format, and print time

name: MYSQL - Check DB Columns for Duplicates
value:
MYSQL - CHECK FOR DUPLICATES
/*EXAMPLE*/
SELECT post_id FROM wp_postmeta GROUP BY post_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 15

/*EXAMPLE*/
CHECK DUPES FOR 3 COLUMNS
SELECT URLshared, UserID, postURL, date, count(*) as NumDuplicates
from socialshares
group by URLshared, UserID, postURL, date
having NumDuplicates > 1
description: MYSQL - Check DB Columns for Duplicates

name: PDO MYSQL - %Like% Concatination Trick
value:
<?php
//PDO CONCAT TRICK (IN PDO MYSQL STATEMENT)
LIKE concat('%', :site, '%') 
?>
description: Useful for finding multiple entries that have the same string within the row. For example, if you mixed versions of links in your table http://www.site.com and http://site.com

name: Nohup - Run Process to background - Debian / Ubuntu
value:
#In preperation to run script
 nohup scriptname &
# (& is to ignore output)

# OR IF ALREADY RUNNING, send process to background
(Ctrl + Z)
bg
disown

#Check running jobs
jobs
description: Use if you want to be able to continue using your terminal, while waiting for a long process to finish executing, or to disown a job, so when you close your terminal session, the job stays running.

name: MySQL DB Import via Shell
value: mysql -u username -p db_name < /path/to/importFile.sql
description: Use this to import a MySQL. In particular, useful if the database is too large to impoart via PHPmyadmin.

name: Gzip and Tar .tar.gz zipping and un-zipping
value:
#GZIP A DIRECTORY
tar -cv directory | gzip > archive.tar.gz
#EXCLUDE
tar -cv --exclude='./folder' directory | gzip > archive.tar.gz

#UNZIP
tar -zxvf archive.tar.gz
description: Gzip + Tar, unzip, untar.

name: Regex to get only link targets from HTML source
description:
Extract Link targets from HTML source code
Note: works in sublime text 3

name: Regex - Extract dates
description: Extract dates of a certain format from source

name: REGEX - Find string between words
value:
#REGEX - find string between <link> and </link>
<l\w\wk>([^<]+)<\/l\w\wk>

#REGEX - find string between <loc> and </loc>
<l\wc>([^<]+)<\/l\wc>
description: A couple example of extracting words between look-behind / look-ahead strings

name: HTaccess - Redirect HTTP to HTTPS
value:
#in .htaccess file (and <ifmodule> if visible)
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off
RewriteRule (.*) https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI}/ [R=301,L]

#Another way
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [L,R=301]

# Force SSL - ANOTHER WAY TO FORCE HTTPS
RewriteCond %{HTTPS} !=on
RewriteRule ^/?(.*) https://%{SERVER_NAME}/$1 [R=301,L]
description: HTACCESS - REDIRECT HTTP TO HTTPS

name: PHP Output Buffer
value:
<?php
ob_start();
//Do Other things like include files if needed, that shouldn't be visible at time of execution
$string = ob_get_clean();
//$string contains the output that is hidden by output buffer, in case we want to print it later, or send the info to a different function.
?>
description: Useful when you want to hide the output of php functions for use later in the code. Example: Custom Logging files

name: UNIX - List disks
value: lsblk -o NAME,SIZE,FSTYPE,TYPE,MOUNTPOINT
description:
List all physical disks, useful when checking mountpoint / Fstab / Raid setup
Compatable with GRUB loader as well

name: Shell Command to Dump Databases from MySQL
value:
mysqldump -u root -p --opt --all-databases > alldb.sql
#VARIATION TO AVOID CONFLICT ON RUNNING DB:
mysqldump -u root -p --all-databases --skip-lock-tables > alldb.sql
#IMPORT Command:
mysql -u root -p < alldb.sql
description: Can be helpful to grab many databases at once in a coallition. Notice: Doesn't account for table errors and inconsistencies when importing, use caution.

name: Bind DNS from Shell
value:
BIND DNS from CLI using named (email VPS)
- find where DNS files are stored. named is usually at /etc/named.conf 
- In our case, named.conf links to files in /var/named directory
- Find the table.db, or .zone file associated with the domain in question (example /var/named/goldsteinbrossard.com.db)
- Restart named service: service named restart
description:
Example runs on CentOS
Source: https://www.tecmint.com/setup-master-slave-dns-server-in-centos/

name: PHP - Associative array sort Alphabetically
value: array_multisort($array, SORT_ASC);
description: Sorting an array within an array, by ABC.

name: Check MDADM Raid Setup
value:
#VIEW OVERALL STATUS: 
cat /proc/mdstat
#Note: [UU] = Both good | [UF] = 1 drive failure | [FF] = Both drives fail. Verbose command:
sudo mdadm --detail /dev/md0
description: Tips: https://www.tldp.org/HOWTO/Software-RAID-HOWTO-6.html

name: MDADM - Set monitor and notification
value: sudo mdadm --monitor --deamonise --mail=backups+reaver+mdadm@contradtool.com --delay=1800 /dev/md0
description: This example command will run every 1800 seconds to check the disks for errors, and sets up the notification

name: Jekyll Setup and Use Info
value:
JEKYLL BRAIN DUMP

Workstation Setup:
1. Install Ruby
2. Install Jekyll
3. Login/setup Gitlab.com account, join CAGB group
4. Install Git
5. Recommended: VS Code
    extension: Jekyll Snippets

Project Work Setup:
0. navigate to desired project folder on local hard-drive/machine
1. git pull https://projecturl
2. run: jekyll s -o 
    - if that doesn't work, try using bundler:
        gem install bundler 
        run: bundle update
        then run: bundle exec jekyll s -o
    - optionally try adding a -l flag to either command to use livereload
3. You now have a local development server running, 
    make changes to any file and reload to see your changes.
    If you make any changes to config.yml, restart your `jekyll s` process
4. When content with changes, stop your `jekyll s` process and run `jekyll b`
    This will build your website with `env=production`
5. Push all changes to git
6. If autodeploy is configured, you're done. 
    If it's not, copy the contents of the _site dir to the live web server. 
    Be sure to delete any unwanted files from the live server

Continued Project Work:
0. navigate to the existing project folder on your machine
1. git sync any changes (you can use the vs code sidebar)
2. continue as in 'project work setup'

New Project Setup:
A starter Jekyll site can be created with 'jekyll new yoursitename', 
however this uses an external gem based theme that is less intuitive to work on and troubleshoot. 
For this reason I recommend starting from an existing site build, or from 'cagb-blank-jekyll'.
Most commonly used website specific variables should be set in config.yml
- enter all relevant information in config.yml
- swap the favicons and logo.png
- delete all old website files and pages
- update sass variables in minima.scss
description: How to set up and use Jekyll

name: Jekyll - Deploy to AWS
value:
AWS_PROFILE=profile S3_BUCKET=bucket s3_website push
#First make sure gem 's3_website' is added to the gemfile then run bundle update
#Then add bucket info to _config.yaml 
#profile: <%= ENV['AWS_PROFILE'] %>
#s3_bucket: <%= ENV['S3_BUCKET'] %>
description: Push local build to AWS S3 bucket.

name: Jekyll Build Production
value: JEKYLL_ENV=production bundle exec jekyll build
description: Command to build jekyll site with production environment

name: Jekyll Build Production
value: JEKYLL_ENV=production bundle exec jekyll build
description: Command to build jekyll site with production environment

name: Wordpress ACF review repeater setup
description:
Instructions:
- Install Advanced custom field pro
- Save the acf-export.json to a file
- Create a reviews page on Wordpress (/reviews)
- Copy page-reviews.php template file, customize as needed.
-- Make sure to grab the review images for the theme folder.
- Set review page template, set ACF rule to run on page /reviews.
- Insert reviews

name: Scrapy VM Commands
value:
#if needed, install pip
apt-install python3-pip
#if needed, install virtualenv
pip install virtualenv
#make a new virtual environment
virtualenv some_dir/
#activate new virtual env.
cd some_dir
source bin/activate
#install needed packages into new environment. The following are needed for scrapy:
sudo apt-get install python-dev python-pip libxml2-dev libxslt1-dev zlib1g-dev libffi-dev libssl-dev python3 python3-dev
#deactivate
deactivate
description: Useful commands, setting up a virtula environment and scrapy-related processes.

name: Bash reload startup
value: source ~/.bashrc
description: Reloads bash src, useful if you set up an alias so you don't need to close the terminal.

name: Scrapy Shell Commands
value:
#initiate the scrapy shell, if in the root of a project - settings are inherited (such as vm)
scrapy shell 'https://whatismyip.com/' #use double-quotes on windows

#use xpath to query the HTML for the IP
>>> response.xpath('//*[@id="post-7"]/div[1]/div[1]/div/ul/li[1]').get()

#proxy, just follow this guide https://github.com/aivarsk/scrapy-proxies

#Example https://www.yelp.com/biz/usa-electric-los-angeles-18
#for each sibling element of the xpath selector
for review in response.xpath('//*[@id="wrap"]/div[3]/div/div[1]/div[2]/div/div/div[2]/div[1]/section[9]/div/section[2]/div[2]/div/ul/li'):
    body = review.css("span.lemon--span__373c0__3997G::text").get()
    print(dict(body=body))
#or retreive the JSON element
response.xpath('//*[@id="wrap"]/div[3]/script[1]').get()
#see the scrapy shell tutorial for more https://docs.scrapy.org/en/latest/intro/tutorial.html
description: Commands to use in the scrapy shell
